definitions.definition: to be in or move into a horizontal position on a surface:
If something lies in a particular place, position, or direction, it is in that place, position, or direction:
examples: There's an old pair of shoes of yours lying at/in the bottom of the wardrobe.
The hardest part of the competition still lies ahead of us.

definitions.definition: If responsibility, blame, a decision, a choice, etc. lies with someone, they have responsibility, must make the decision, etc.:
examples: Responsibility for the disaster must ultimately lie with the government.

definitions.definition: When the dead body of an important person lies in state, it is arranged so that the public can see and honour it before it is buried.
something you say that you know is not true:
examples: I told a lie when I said I liked her haircut.
